result.title: The%20Orb%3A%20Evmos%20Public%20Goods%20Funding
result.plaintext:
Abstract

A wide variety of web3 public goods (such as tools, plugins and educational content) provide necessary infrastructure essential to the growth of blockchain ecosystems.

Most web3 public goods and open-source software rely on donations to fund their work. With the introduction of crypto, much has been done to complement the traditional donation process (i.e individuals and/or charities raise funds in order to donate to causes) including the introduction of crypto-based payments, quadratic funding, tokenized rewards to donors, etc.

Despite these evolutions, donations are still made by giving money from your available capital to a public good. This results in an opportunity cost whereby donors forgo financial gain in favor of supporting a charity or cause. For smaller donors with lesser wealth, continuing to donate in this way may be more daunting as it relies on their ability to replenish their principal.

Through The Orb, we change this paradigm by introducing a novel way to fund web3 public goods. Instead of donating principal to public goods, donors allocate a portion of their yield from staked capital. This injects capital back into the ecosystem and enables donors to participate in a predictable, long-term manner.

In order to compensate for the donated yield, The Orb compounds yield to achieve a much higher APY. It also issues Orb governance tokens so donors get a say in which projects are funded, and awards donors with NFT, swag, etc. to channel natural reward/status seeking behavior into public goods.

In the prevailing staking model, proof-of-stake facilitates the extraction of financial value to stakers, but only provides limited mechanisms (e.g. restaking) to reinject value back into the ecosystem.

Through The Orb, stakers can provide essential support needed for the development of foundational technologies such as tools, plugins and educational content.

Donating to these shared resources unlock enormous value as they accelerate adoption by making it easier to onboard developers, dapps and users. This in-turn redistributes value back to all stakeholders, creating a circular economy.

In this proposal we seek community support to set up The Orb and stake some of the Evmos community’s capital (currently locked by the foundation) through The Orb in order to bootstrap public goods funding within the Evmos ecosystem.

Definition of a web3 public good

The traditional definition of a public good is a commodity or service that is provided without profit to all members of a society. In web3, the definition of a public good is different. It consists of the following characteristics:

Has longevity: It’s both achievable and indefinitely maintainable.

Creates positive externalities: It benefits a larger audience and goes beyond an immediate set of users.

Is universally accessible: It should be accessible to anyone in the world and is both free to use and open-source.

Examples of public goods

Foundry: A development tool to build Ethereum applications used by many thousands of developers ( https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry )

POAPs: NFT badges issued to commemorate events such as twitter spaces calls and hundreds of crypto conferences ( https://poap.gallery )

Devpill.me : A community led blockchain development guide ( https://www.devpill.me/ )

Lenster: A decentralized, and permissionless social media app ( https://lenster.xyz )

Bloom Network: An international community of people and projects creating and nurturing regenerative cultures ( https://bloomnetwork.org/ )

Project overview

Many web3 public goods primarily rely on donations to fund their work. These include developer tools, plugins, extensions and educational content that are managed and maintained by millions of downstream contributors.

Given the importance of donations, much work has been done in web3 to facilitate the fundraising process. Platforms such as Giveth, Gitcoin and Protocol Guild amongst others have reorganized funding in web3 to be more efficient, transparent and rewarding to donors.

Notable improvements include:

Increased opportunities for not-for-profit projects to receive donations in crypto

Optimized distribution with seasonal funding rounds and better fund allocation methods such as matching grants, quadratic funding and vesting contracts

Improved incentives through tokenizing contributions and offering donor rewards in the form of financial tokens and NFTs

Yet, little has been done to change the traditional model of donation. In the current model, donors incur an opportunity cost in order to support a cause, as they forgo future gains from their principal.

This can be challenging for many donors with lesser wealth, as it relies on their ability to replenish their principal in order to continue making donations.

In the prevailing staking model, proof-of-stake extracts financial value to stakers, without providing many mechanisms (aside from restaking) to reinject value back into the ecosystem.

Through The Orb, we change this paradigm by introducing a novel way to fund web3 public goods.

Donors stake their capital, and allocate a portion of their gains to public goods. This injects capital back into the ecosystem in a way that benefits everyone.

As a result, donors don't diminish their principal, while participating in a predictable, long-term funding model for public goods.

Why this matters

By reinjecting yield into public goods, donors provide the essential support needed for the development of foundational technology such as tools, plugins and educational content that benefit the entire ecosystem continuously and effortlessly.

These shared resources unlock enormous value as they accelerate adoption by making it easier to onboard more developers, dapps and users.

Reinjecting yield from staked capital into an ecosystem redistributes value to all stakeholders, creating a circular economy.

Wen ATH? :)

(image)

How it works

Users stake Evmos through The Orb Program. They can choose any validator, including any node they are already staking on.

The Orb program auto-compounds daily on behalf of the user (for a much higher ROI), allocates 15% to the public goods treasury and distributes the rest of the yield back to the user.

Funds are allocated to public goods projects including the Orb, which retains a portion for operating, maintaining and growing the project.

Governance

For each Evmos token donated to public goods, donors receive governance tokens.

Funds collected in The Orb Public Goods Treasury are managed by a DAO controlled by donors.

These tokens allow governance across 3 vectors:

Proposals and projects that would receive funding

Orb strategic decisions (operations, fees, legal etc.)

Electing and removing project vetting council members

Vision

To generate predictable, long-term funding for public goods, while securing blockchains and developing ecosystems.

Website URL

www.stakeorb.xyz

Fees and Funding Structure

Anyone can deploy funds to any Evmos node and receive 85% of the yield generated as a reward.

The balance 15%, will be allocated to The Orb public goods treasury.

Governance token holders will be able to vote on how the funds are allocated.

Returns

Returns will vary based on the block reward Evmos emission schedule. The current APY can be viewed here .

Challenges and Risks

Attacks/Hacks on the ecosystem (blockchain, nodes, bridges, wallets, dapp etc.)

Donating rewards to The Orb when liquid staking is introduced

Slashing events

Node downtime/jailing

Ability to attract public goods

Tax concessions (in different jurisdictions)

Project Selection

The public goods need to directly benefit the Evmos ecosystem.

Projects must also fulfill the criteria set out in the public goods definition section.

All projects requesting funds and fund emission schedules are subject to approval by governance.

Roadmap

Setup public goods node (2 weeks): Setup the Evmos non-custodial yield optimization app.

Setup The Orb DAO and multi-sig treasury (8 weeks): Setup The Orb DAO, the public goods multisig and The Orb foundation as a not-for-profit entity.

Token airdrop contract (2 weeks): Issue governance tokens to donors.

Setup public goods application process (12 weeks): Setup the applicant website and finalize the fund distribution mechanism.

Launch Orb grants season 1: Fund first public goods.

Team

The team behind The Orb consists of:

Sheran (@sheran_sc), Patrick (@iampotrok) and Sam (@samirxcv): Core contributors of Lighthouse DAO (@lighthouse_dao), a decentralized proof-of-contribution protocol for web3 reputation and credentialing. Currently working on bringing the Lighthouse protocol to Evmos.

Sebastien Couture (@seb3point0): Founder of Interop Ventures (@InteropVC), host of the Epicenter and The Interop podcasts, currently running Evmos Node “Interop”.

William Mougayar (@wmougayar): Early investor and advisory board member of the Ethereum Foundation, Executive Chairman, Kin Foundation.

Jean-Philippe Jabre (@jpjabre1): Founder of Plassa Capital and investor in the Jabcap Family Office interested in public goods funding mechanisms.

Requests

1. Request to channel existing locked capital by the Evmos Foundation through The Orb

The Evmos foundation recently staked approx. $10M Evmos on medium-sized nodes to promote network decentralization. We would like to explore the possibility of:

Re-staking a portion of the existing delegation to the same mid-sized nodes through The Orb program.

Issue a new delegation of $2M to 5M from the community pool to mid-sized nodes promoting further network decentralization through The Orb program.

Staking through The Orb program has no impact on nodes, but it allocates 15% of the yield to the public goods treasury, which is controlled by Orb token holders.

The capital staked will not be accessible to us and will be owned by the Evmos community.

The exact request of funds will be decided based on the outcome of the poll attached to this discussion.

2. Request for funds

120,000 EVMOS vesting over 1 year to bootstrap The Orb foundation. These funds will be used to cover:

Development costs: The funds will be used to develop the non-custodial yield optimization app, token airdrop contracts, grant application process and associated website.

Maintenance costs (during the bootstrap period): The funds will also be used to cover maintenance costs for a period of 1 year. These include patches and updates, monitoring, infrastructure costs etc associated with managing and maintaining Orb services. After 1 year, our goal is to fund this through The Orb DAO (subject to governance) which itself would be a public good.

Setup costs related to The Orb Foundation: The funds will also be used to cover any setup costs including legal fees associated with setting up The Orb Foundation as a not-for-profit entity.

Fund allocation breakdown

25% - At the start of the project

50% - At the governance token airdrop event

25% - At The Orb grants S1 launch

Frequently Asked

1. Which nodes will I be able to stake on?

You can stake on any Evmos node through The Orb program.

2. Will The Orb be set up as a not-for-profit?

Yes.

3. Will The Orb be run as an Evmos Workstream / Sub-DAO?

We are open to the idea! The specific mechanisms need to be discussed.

4. What makes this better than traditional grants programs?

We purposefully designed The Orb to be a community-centric, egalitarian public good. It is very much a public good for public goods. In this way, our value proposition is what distinguishes us from other grants programs. We allow users and organizations to grow their capital while also creating a steady flow of capital towards a public goods treasury.

This process aligns incentives for all parties involved: donors/stakers, the public goods projects, The Orb, and the Evmos ecosystem. Furthermore, one-off donations are fleeting as they lack to establish a relationship between the donor and the cause. The Orb, however, offers continuous access to these donors to vote on further funding of projects (and, in turn, the future direction of Evmos) for as long as the user is a part of the DAO

5. Who decides which projects get funded?

The Orb governance token holders. These tokens can be acquired by anyone contributing to public goods through The Orb.

6. What about early contributors having a lion share of the voting power?

While governance tokens are allocated based on contributions to public goods, the exact governance mechanism can be finalized and tweaked as the project progresses.

7. Is The Orb chain specific?

Yes. Other than the idea and concept, all operational aspects including governance, project selection, vetting, and funding are all decided by the Evmos community. We hope to foster a culture of public goods that’s specific to Evmos, while learning lessons from other chains and improving the project as a whole for everyone!

8. How will you ensure the safety of the treasury from being exploited & DAO from spam?

The treasury will be controlled by a multisig and all requests for funding will follow an application process governed by a project vetting council.

9. How would The Orb work in conjunction with Liquid Staking?

It’s still too early to tell. Two possible solutions are:

We partner with the liquid staking service so that funds can directly be staked on The Orb

We re-wrap the synthetic asset and issue our own token

References

a16z: The web3 landscape October 2021 [ https://a16z.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/The-web3-Readlng-List.pdf ]

Gitcoin: Seeking a New Kind of Public Good: Open Call for Proposals [ https://gitcoin.co/blog/seeking-a-new-kind-of-public-good/ ]

Ten Reasons Why People Don’t Donate to Charity [ https://www.thelifeyoucansave.org/common-objections-to-giving/ ]

A Guide To Public Goods for New Web3 Devs [ https://medium.com/ankr-network/a-guide-to-public-goods-for-new-web3-devs-59befc40ae77 ]

Funding Public Goods in web3 for the Uninitiated [ https://jessykate.medium.com/funding-public-goods-in-web3-for-the-uninitiated-27493693c25c ]

Recent discussions

Interoperable Smart Contacts on Cosmos – Jacob Gadikian of Notional Labs https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OkdKfPVjTss (From 09:00 onward)

MEV in the interchain – Sean Braithwaite of Mekatek: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7RW8i2vUeuo&t=3232s (From minute 53:52 onward)

Currently working on bringing the Lighthouse protocol to Evmos.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Sebastien Couture (@seb3point0):\"},{\"insert\":\" Founder of Interop Ventures (@InteropVC), host of the Epicenter and The Interop podcasts, currently running Evmos Node “Interop”.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"William Mougayar (@wmougayar):\"},{\"insert\":\" Early investor and advisory board member of the Ethereum Foundation, Executive Chairman, Kin Foundation.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Jean-Philippe Jabre (@jpjabre1):\"},{\"insert\":\" Founder of Plassa Capital and investor in the Jabcap Family Office interested in public goods funding mechanisms.\\n\\nRequests\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":1},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n1. Request to channel existing locked capital by the Evmos Foundation through The Orb\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe Evmos foundation recently staked approx. $10M Evmos on medium-sized nodes to promote network decentralization. We would like to explore the possibility of:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Re-staking a portion of the existing delegation to the same mid-sized nodes through The Orb program.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Issue a new delegation of $2M to 5M from the community pool to mid-sized nodes promoting further network decentralization through The Orb program.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nStaking through The Orb program has no impact on nodes, but it allocates 15% of the yield to the public goods treasury, which is controlled by Orb token holders.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"The capital staked will not be accessible to us and will be owned by the Evmos community.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe exact request of funds will be decided based on the outcome of the poll attached to this discussion.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n2. Request for funds\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n120,000 EVMOS vesting over 1 year to bootstrap The Orb foundation. These funds will be used to cover:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Development costs:\"},{\"insert\":\" The funds will be used to develop the non-custodial yield optimization app, token airdrop contracts, grant application process and associated website.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Maintenance costs (during the bootstrap period):\"},{\"insert\":\" The funds will also be used to cover maintenance costs for a period of 1 year. These include patches and updates, monitoring, infrastructure costs etc associated with managing and maintaining Orb services. After 1 year, our goal is to fund this through The Orb DAO (subject to governance) which itself would be a public good.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Setup costs related to The Orb Foundation:\"},{\"insert\":\" The funds will also be used to cover any setup costs including legal fees associated with setting up The Orb Foundation as a not-for-profit entity.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Fund allocation breakdown\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n25% - At the start of the project\\n50% - At the governance token airdrop event\\n25% - At The Orb grants S1 launch\\n\\nFrequently Asked\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":1},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"1. Which nodes will I be able to stake on?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nYou can stake on any Evmos node through The Orb program.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"2. Will The Orb be set up as a not-for-profit?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nYes.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"3. Will The Orb be run as an Evmos Workstream / Sub-DAO?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nWe are open to the idea! The specific mechanisms need to be discussed.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"4. What makes this better than traditional grants programs?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nWe purposefully designed The Orb to be a community-centric, egalitarian public good. It is very much a public good for public goods. In this way, our value proposition is what distinguishes us from other grants programs. We allow users and organizations to grow their capital while also creating a steady flow of capital towards a public goods treasury.\\n\\nThis process aligns incentives for all parties involved: donors/stakers, the public goods projects, The Orb, and the Evmos ecosystem. Furthermore, one-off donations are fleeting as they lack to establish a relationship between the donor and the cause. The Orb, however, offers continuous access to these donors to vote on further funding of projects (and, in turn, the future direction of Evmos) for as long as the user is a part of the DAO\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"5. Who decides which projects get funded?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe Orb governance token holders. These tokens can be acquired by anyone contributing to public goods through The Orb.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"6. What about early contributors having a lion share of the voting power?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nWhile governance tokens are allocated based on contributions to public goods, the exact governance mechanism can be finalized and tweaked as the project progresses.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"7. Is The Orb chain specific?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nYes. Other than the idea and concept, all operational aspects including governance, project selection, vetting, and funding are all decided by the Evmos community. We hope to foster a culture of public goods that’s specific to Evmos, while learning lessons from other chains and improving the project as a whole for everyone!\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"8. How will you ensure the safety of the treasury from being exploited & DAO from spam?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe treasury will be controlled by a multisig and all requests for funding will follow an application process governed by a project vetting council.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"9. How would The Orb work in conjunction with Liquid Staking?\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nIt’s still too early to tell. Two possible solutions are:\\nWe partner with the liquid staking service so that funds can directly be staked on The Orb\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"We re-wrap the synthetic asset and issue our own token\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nReferences\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":1},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\na16z: The web3 landscape October 2021 [\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://a16z.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/The-web3-Readlng-List.pdf\"},\"insert\":\"https://a16z.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/The-web3-Readlng-List.pdf\"},{\"insert\":\"]\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"ordered\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Gitcoin: result.title: Grant Request - FootieSZN
result.plaintext:
Project name

FootieSZN

Date of submission

20th of Oct 2022

Name of company

FOOTIE SZN LABS LIMITED (BVI)

Contact information

Gbolahan Onadeko (twitter ) ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/flarcos/ )

Habeeb Bombata (twitter) ( https://linkedin.com/in/nottherealillest )

Email :

info@footieszn.com

Funding requested (in USD)

$200,000

Team Information:

Habeeb Bombata - Operations & Product - previously at Float YCW21, Paxful, Cloudbees, Bento.

Gbolahan Onadeko - Product & Engineering - 8+ years blockchain veteran.

Dan Mgbor (BENQI co-founder) - Angel investor and Advisor

Jesse Ghansah( Float and OMG digital ) - Angel investor and Advisor

The team behind FootieSZN has been building blockchain-based applications for over 3 years, A few of the Projects the team has previously worked on include :

Dappy network : A stablecoin to fiat offramp platform that allows users receive payments across 80+ countries worldwide.

UniversalAPI : A payment clearing platform that allows businesses to send and receive funds.

What is FootieSZN:

FootieSzn is a fantasy football game in which participants assemble an imaginary team of real-life football players and score points based on those players' actual statistical performance or their perceived contribution on the field of play. We are currently operating out of the British virgin islands with aspirations to extend operations around the world.

It is estimated that the 2022 world cup finals in Qatar will be watched by over 5 billion people. At least 8 out of 10 people support one form of sport and are very knowledgeable about it, Football/Soccer fans are estimated to be around 3.5 billion people.

With almost no learning curve for fans, we are developing a fantasy sports service that enables individuals to participate, earn, and enjoy what they are already fans of.

The Total number of blockchain users is estimated at around 80m WorldWide, FootieSZN can build a fantasy football gaming experience to tap into such a huge fan base which will be a huge win for the blockchain economy, especially Evmos, Also FootieSZN is not just stopping at Football/Soccer, We plan to expand and create an SZNVerse where we build fantasy for each sport (Cricket, NBA, NFL, Ruby, Baseball, etc).

FootieSZN has been in development for a little over a year, A lot of which has been mostly researching and engineering phases, and in that time we have built out an MVP which we launched on a Testnet in August 2022 with 4,000+ Participants currently. We have been running on a very lean budget, mostly bootstrapped with some help from some Angel Investors.

We are yet to raise our Pre-Seed/Seed round.

We are asking the Evmos Community with this proposal to help fund our development to take it to the next level.

What is the place of the SZN token?

We are building toward an SZN Verse that would consist of various fantasy sports.

(Football/Soccer, Basketball, Cricket, Ruby, etc) With each Sport having a large fan base, we are creating a medium of value that would be used in SZN Verse,

SZN is the medium of exchange in SZN Verse.

How will it gain & maintain the value?

FootieSZN operates a freemium model however Users would be required to use SZN tokens to enhance their experience with different game modes.

Buying function performing NFT like Booster Packs (Triple Captain, Clean Sheet, etc)

Buying cosmetic type NFTs like Managers, Badges, themes, etc

Creating private leagues and pools.

Creating sponsored leagues.

Scouts Reports.

Please note that the above is currently for just Football/Soccer, as we expand into other sports the list of utilities will increase.

Onboarding Users:

Onboarding web2 users is a priority for FootieSZN, We plan to build out an Android & IOS App that will make it easy for regular users to onboard and use FootieSZN easily, Existing Web3 users will also be onboarded but our focus will be on web2 users, by building engineering infrastructure or leveraging existing technologies like Ramper/Arcana to abstract complex details like wallet addresses, etc

Users will be able to sign up with just their email addresses and no prior crypto gaming experience.

Why FootieSZN over another fantasy protocol?

FootieSZN intends to stay true to being a traditional fantasy sport protocol, unlike existing Fantasy protocols/ Platforms that require participants to sink a lot of funds to be able to be competitive.

Eg: A new user onboarding on SORARE will need an average of $1420 to be averagely competitive in its league system, In FootieSZN player NFTs are free and this removes the onboarding barriers and allow people to enjoy and play the game they love and support while they enhance their experience within their finance.

What will this app look like when it’s first ready?

FootieSZN will launch first with Soccer/Football right before the start of the 2023/2024 season then we estimate releasing at least one more sport before the end of 2023.

Our setup which we built Soccer on, allows us to integrate other sports faster, we would estimate around a 6-month development period to launch.

We will always try to launch a new sport before the season starts.

Game modes in FootieSZN?

The game mode in the football FootieSZN:

General League: This league is a public league owned by the platform in which everyone can participate.

1V1: Participants on FootieSZN can challenge each other to a single matchday contest where the participant with the highest points wins the pool prize created between the two users.

Worldcup: build your team based on the countries and players participating in the World Cup and contest against other teams.

StoryMode: (Stealth)

Go-to-market strategy / Customer acquisition.

We believe our strongest customer acquisition path will be the community.

We're going to focus on growing and engaging a community of fantasy sports fans by

Leveraging and partnering with existing Reddit / discord gaming communities

Partnering with local sport fan bases across multiple teams/stadiums

Leveraging local Facebook and telegram communities

Weekly content, videos, blogs, and engagement on social media

In-app referral system

Partnering with sports influencers and journalists that already have cult-like followers and community

Sponsoring local community sporting events

Weekly twitter spaces, town halls, and more to keep the community engaged.

What are the expected costs for the audits, smart contracts, and other features?

We are actively building and will require more funds as we progress.

We are estimating costs for product development around $200k, there are also marketing costs and more.

The estimate for just one of our smart contracts is about $8500 (we have multiple smart contracts)

Will the Evmos community cover all of this?

We do not expect Evmos to cover all the development costs as we will raise them with VCs as well.

This initial funding will get us to a place where we can build a fantastic MVP that will change

the crypto gaming space.

Will you only be fantasy & final outcome prediction, or will you ever move to a full-on Bovata-style betting platform?

Based on the vision we have, we want to build a game people will love and play.

FootieSZN will only be a fantasy, final outcome prediction, and simulation sports platform, We will not be exploring the Bovata style betting because that would require a lot of legal and license requirements and FootieSZN may be restricted in some geographical areas.

Currently, anyone from anywhere in the world is able to play with FootieSZN because it does not require any form of license to operate.

After this funding, will you need any more funds to complete a full-fledged product? Will you be transparent on funds raised from investors & sales vs Evmos community funding

Yes, We are looking to raise a seed round of $2.8M(3 years roadmap), we will be interested in the help we can get towards that from EVMOS and the community.

Note: This is after MVP has been shipped on EVMOS.

Will you be airdropping to Stakers or Holders if this passes?

Not at this time.

Have you finished the Q3 markers on your roadmap?

All Q3 markers are ready for implementation and will be merged soon, Features planned for Q4 are currently in the test phase and will be implemented soon.

Below is our Roadmap:

Q3 2022:

Testnet EPL

Team creation

Booster Pack NFTs

Q4 2022:

Pay gas in SZN token

1v1 Match

Private League

The world cup (fantasy and prediction)

Q1 2023:

Escrow for core, private and 1v1

Q2 2023:

End of Testnet

Start of Mainnet (All Major Leagues)

Q3 2023: SZN VERSE

Expanding into other sports (Cricket, NBA, etc)

How will FootieSZN bring value to the Evmos ecosystem?

For every web2 user or player FootieSZN onboard into its platform, they will be exposed to the Evmos Ecosystem.

The active wallets and Tx count on Evmos should increase with the number of web2 users we plan to reach.

FootieSZN being an active member of the Evmos community will then host Twitter space or events where new projects can be showcased.

With each of these participants holding value in SZN tokens, it will increase the value held natively in the Evmos ecosystem.

Being a native Evmos token will bring liquidity and transaction volume to the chain

Testnet on EVMOS

Fantasy Premier League(testnet)

Fantasy Premier League demo video

Fantasy gallery

Worldcup predict(testnet)

Worldcup predict video

Data from test-net

4,000+ Signups and Team created (testnet)

Globally diverse Participant

1200+ discord community members

Research data :

https://buybitcoinworldwide.com/blockchain-statistics/ (Total number of blockchain users)

https://www.topendsports.com/world/lists/popular-sport/fans.htm (popular sports stats)

https://www.sportspromedia.com/news/fifa-2022-world-cup-qatar-tv-audience-viewers-gianni-infantino/ ( FIFA WorldCup final viewership)

Based on feedback fro, @Kevin Garrison | Oni Validator

Milestone 1:

Smart contract Audit

Worldcup Predict (evmos mainnet)

World cup Fantasy( evmos mainnet)

Milestone 2:

1v1 Match

Private League

Milestone 3:

Escrow for core, private and 1v1

Smart Contract Audit for (1v1, private, and core) smart contract

View tokenomics here: https://docsend.com/view/sx94d2zzeuhk2mi2

We will be offering the seed section: 200k USD= 25M SZN.

result.title: Grant Request - Evmos Developer Acquisition w/ Dystopia Labs (2023)
result.plaintext:
Dear Evmos Community,

Who Are We:

I'm Hsin-Ju, founder & CEO of Dystopia Labs ( http://dystopialabs.com). We host ETH events all around the world, including the upcoming ETH.Seattle, ETH Seoul, and DeFi Bogota. Since our inception in 2019, we’ve hosted 449+ workshops and 18 summits with reach in 19+ countries. With over 32,000+ registrants for our events, we’ve built strong crypto hubs in SF, LA, Austin, Portland, and brought in 345+ speakers from ETH Foundation, 0x, Curve, Aave, Osmosis, Sommelier, & more. TLDR; we have a strong developer community.

Why Our Proposal Matters:

Since Evmos is an EVM compatible chain, there’s a huge opportunity for us to collaborate together to bring new developers and projects into the Evmos ecosystem.

Dystopia Labs would like to invite Evmos to speak at our upcoming 5 IRL events in 2023:

ETH Portland (Jan 2023)

DeFi Denver (Feb 2023; right before ETH Denver)

ETH Austin (April 2023; right before Consensus)

ETH Seattle (July 2023)

ETH Vancouver (Aug 2023)

We are looking to ask the Evmos team for $15k support per event, totaling to $75k in 2023. This will help cover venue costs, AV, staging, furniture, and food.

We expect 300-350 attendees per event and about 800-1000 registrants (Evmos will get the email list). And like always, our events are 100% free to attendees so we’d love to have the Evmos community get involved and attend.

To us, a successful event would be oversubscribed, have fantastic speakers, and help bring more awareness and interest in the Evmos ecosystem.

In the past, we’ve had speakers like: Vitalik Buterin, Austin Griffith, the Flashbot’s team, Stani Kulechov, the CEO of Aave, the SEC Commissioner, and more. TLDR; you will be in good company at our events.

Other sponsors include: UMA, 1inch Exchange, Figment, Rarible, and more.

WHY THE CONFERENCES WERE VALUABLE TO EVMOS

Beyond brand recognition and on-site education, the email list is the highest value thing a sponsor can get out of any event. As part of our sponsorship agreement, Evmos would get the email list of all the conference attendees per event. This is a huge value add because the Evmos team can reach out to the attendees (who listened to the Evmos talk IRL) and drive them to more dense educational content (ie. like videos, blog posts, documentation, etc) after the event. They can even use these lists to even create their own event series (if they so wished). Over time, as they participate in more and more events, Evmos will be able to convert people who they met IRL into advocates (simply b/c they are able to reach attendees after the event and to continue pushing them down the funnel). TLDR; registrant lists will be a huge value add for the Evmos community.

We’re Part Of The Ecosystem:

Our goal is to build a long-term relationship w/ the Evmos team / ecosystem and be a consistent contributor. We have also not sold ANY of the $EVMOS tokens that we've received. We're in it for the long haul :) In 2022, EVMOS participated in 2 of our events, HackSummit SF & DeFi Bogota. As a summary, here are the key stats for the 2 events Evmos participated in:

For DeFi Bogota: https://2022.defibogota.org/

100% free for attendees

2024 registrants (Evmos will get the email list)

~700 attendees

20 speakers

21 sessions

18 talks

1 panel

2 workshops

7 hrs of content

For Hacksummit SF: https://sf.hacksummit.org/

100% free for attendees

916 registrants (Evmos will get the email list)

~350 attendees

30 sessions

24 talks

1 panel

5 workshops

10 hrs of content

Video Recording Package (Optional):

Currently, Dystopia Labs does not record sessions at our conferences. However, if there's interest in recording Evmos talks at our events, we can include an optional recording package for $30k (= $6k per event across 5 events). With this package, the entire conference will be recorded and we'll post the recordings on youtube for viewers to watch. To thank the Evmos community for their support, for ALL the videos, we'll link to the Evmos site in "Descriptions" to help drive traffic. If there's interest in this option, please vote accordingly on the poll.

We're open to the community's feedback on our event series!

result.title: DeFi Bogota - A Retrospective
result.plaintext:
It's been a week since we hosted DeFi Bogota ( https://2022.defibogota.org/) in Bogota, Colombia. I wanted to reach out to the EVMOS community and offer a retrospective. We're so pleased w/ how everything turned out - a gorgeous venue, tasty food, and awesome people! Thank you all so much for sponsoring $15k for this event!

CONTEXT:

I'm Hsin-Ju, founder & CEO of Dystopia Labs ( http://dystopialabs.com). We host ETH events all around the world. Since our inception in 2019, we’ve hosted 449+ workshops and 15 summits with reach in 18+ countries. With over 28,000+ registrants for our events, we’ve built strong crypto hubs in SF, LA, Austin, Portland, and brought in 345+ speakers from ETH Foundation, 0x, Curve, Aave, Osmosis, Sommelier, & more. TLDR; we have a strong developer community.

HIGHLIGHTS:

We organized DeFi Bogota ( https://2022.defibogota.org/) on October 10th, the day before Devcon. The conference was a huge success. People loved the community vibe and the great lineup of speakers.

Here are a few key highlights:

100% free event for attendees

2024 registrants (evmos will get the email list)

~700 attendees

20 speakers

21 sessions

18 talks

1 panel

2 workshops

7 hrs of content

How We Spent The Money:

We received $30k from EVMOS ($15k towards Hacksummit SF & $15k towards DeFi Bogota). We had an overall budget of $125k for DeFi Bogota. The venue and catering made up the bulk of the costs. We also worked w/ vendors for AV and furniture setup. We have not sold any of the EVMOS that we received yet.

Thankfully, beyond EVMOS, we also received sponsorship from: UMA, Blocknative, 1inch, Figment, Raid Guild, Mask Network, Ellipti, Harmony, Stacks, Rarible, Protocol Labs, Mina, DODOex, and Coinbase.

Our Plans Moving Forward:

We plan to put on 5 IRL conferences in 2023. We expect the events to be even bigger than this year's.

ETH Portland (January 2023)

DeFi Denver (Feb 2023)

ETH Austin (April 2023)

ETH Seattle (July 2023)

ETH Vancouver (Aug 2023)

We're open to the community's feedback on the event and our general approach to community funding.

result.title: Faucet for DeFi Kickoff
result.plaintext:
Hey! 

The Diffusion incentives will start soon. As you might know, some incentivized pools require to bridge assets from Ethereum via Axelar/Gravity to Evmos. Once they are bridged to Evmos, you must convert them (on the asset page of Evmos) from IBC-coins to ERC-20 tokens. This requires a fee of about ~0.3 Evmos. New ecosystem participants won't own any Evmos at this time, so it is crucial to implement a faucet which funds them. This situation is only temporary, as the team will implement an auto-converseion on protocol level in the near future. Until then, it's our job to onboard new participants with ease to unleash the full potential of the DeFi revival on Evmos. 

As a first attempt we'll implement the faucet on Discord and expand it, if needed, in a separate web app. We'll implement features to avoid any gaming of the faucet with the support of the Orbital Apes team. 

Onboarding 20,000 users is a likely scenario thus we ask for 6,000 Evmos to be used for dust. Unused Evmos will be returned within 6 months. 

Let me know what you think about it

The Diffusion incentives will start next week. As you might now, some incentivized pools require to bridge assets from Ethereum via Axelar/Gravity to Evmos. Once they are bridged to Evmos, you must convert them (on the asset page of Evmos) from IBC-coins to ERC-20 tokens. This requires a fee of about ~0.3 Evmos. Until then, it's our job to onboard new participants with ease to unleash the full potential of the DeFi revival on Evmos. 

As a first attempt we'll implement the faucet on Discord and expand it, if needed, in a separate web app. We'll implement features to avoid any gaming of the faucet with the support of the Orbital Apes team. 

Onboarding 20,000 users is a likely scenario thus we ask for 6,000 Evmos to be used for dust. Unused Evmos will be returned within 6 months. 

Let me know what you think about it

result.title: Temperature Check - Cosmos L1 Token Swaps
result.plaintext:
Evmos is in need of liquidity. An idea that’s been floating around is L1-L1 token swaps. I’d like to get the discussion rolling on swaps with other Cosmos chains, such as ATOM, Juno, Injective, and Osmosis.

Edit To clarify, these would be direct OTC trades with other treasuries. The swap would not be on the open market; it would not be a huge sell pressure for Evmos.

This would be a first step in introducing EVM native users to the greater Cosmos ecosystem we are a part of.

Strong LPs with little slippage can be seeded by the Evmos DAO. This will also help establish good interchain diplomacy, making us all stronger by these unions.

What is a token swap?

The Evmos DAO would swap EVMOS from the Community Pool for a USD equivalent amount of another Layer 1's tokens. Diversifying our treasury while building working relationships with other Cosmos Chains.

How can it benefit Evmos?

For example the Evmos DAO executes a $500,000 USD equivalent swap of Evmos for Juno. The Juno now held in the Community's treasury is then paired with an equal amount of EVMOS which is added to a Liquidity Pool, providing $1 million of deep liquidity, low slippage access to Juno on the Evmos chain.

While on the Juno chain the same actions occur; this gives Juno users a way to directly access Evmos (avoiding intermediary chains).

In this example, by swapping $500,000 of tokens we create $1 million worth of liquidity on each chain.

What are your thoughts on creating a Token Swap Program?

What other ways could this benefit Evmos?

result.title: [Evmos] Recover IBC tokens from Airdrop
result.plaintext:
# Community Pool Spend: Recover IBC tokens from Airdrop
​
## Author
​
Daniel Burckhardt ([@danburck](https://twitter.com/danburck)), Evmos Core Team
​
## Motivation
​
Evmos’ [Rektdrop](https://medium.com/evmos/the-evmos-rektdrop-abbe931ba823) pioneered a new model for distributing tokens. As announced on the [Evmos dashboard](https://app.evmos.org/mission-control), the Rektdrop ended on Block [5074187](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/blocks/5074187) (30 September 2022 at 16:06:40 UTC) and clawed back of all unclaimed tokens, returning them to the Evmos Community Pool.

During this process, the [IBC module account](https://www.mintscan.io/evmos/account/evmos1a53udazy8ayufvy0s434pfwjcedzqv345dnt3x) was falsely targeted for clawback and transferred all EVMOS tokens from the IBC module account to the Evmos Community Pool. At the time of the clawback, this account held a balance of ~3.2 million EVMOS tokens (3167501226339726493675414aevmos). 

To remediate this unexpected transfer of funds, we propose to return the funds from the Evmos Community Pool back to the IBC module account with this proposal. Note that we are simply withdrawing the amount from the Community Pool that could affect users and not the entire amount in the Community Pool.
​
## Impact
​
The EVMOS tokens on the IBC module account represent the total amount of EVMOS tokens that have been sent to other chains over IBC. Users may currently be encountering an inability to transfer their EVMOS balances on these other chains back to Evmos. This is because there is an insufficient balance on the IBC module account. The Community Pool Spend outlined in this proposal would restore the balance on the IBC module account, enabling users to once again transfer up to their entire balance of EVMOS tokens from other Comsmos chains back to the Evmos chain via IBC.

The bug also falsely targeted some additional user accounts during the clawback. This means that some users' funds were accidentally clawed back to the Community Pool as well. We’ve moved quickly to identify the wallets affected and amounts that each are owed. We are currently planning an additional upgrade that returns these funds as well. 

## Requested amount

The requested amount to be returned to the IBC module account is determined by comparing the account balance one block before the clawback and after the block after the clawback.

Before clawback:

```bash
evmos@evmostest:~/evmos8.2.0/bin$ ./evmosd q bank balances evmos1a53udazy8ayufvy0s434pfwjcedzqv345dnt3x --height 5074186
balances:
- amount: "3167501226339726493675414"
  denom: aevmos
- amount: "100"
  denom: ibc/25813B5DF7C0AF9FB79A71EF8E67FE4E182A03BB4145D248DADFAF74006835B2
- amount: "11000"
  denom: ibc/5CC0E9B98B8C719E3378F941B40A4FAC9F750A155F3788E4C449144C08EA4537
- amount: "12274000"
  denom: ibc/693989F95CF3279ADC113A6EF21B02A51EC054C95A9083F2E290126668149433
- amount: "12000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/6B3FCE336C3465D3B72F7EFB4EB92FC521BC480FE9653F627A0BD0237DF213F3
- amount: "1000000"
  denom: ibc/7F0C2CB6E79CC36D29DA7592899F98E3BEFD2CF77A94340C317032A78812393D
- amount: "2310000"
  denom: ibc/A4DB47A9D3CF9A068D454513891B526702455D3EF08FB9EB558C561F9DC2B701
- amount: "100000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/D8921A62D207159A25FFEA0DB4E7DB623A095219B60D99768CCE9D3DF66122C7
pagination:
  next_key: null
  total: "0"
```

After clawback: 

```bash
evmos@evmostest:~/evmos8.2.0/bin$ ./evmosd q bank balances evmos1a53udazy8ayufvy0s434pfwjcedzqv345dnt3x --height 5074187
balances:
- amount: "100"
  denom: ibc/25813B5DF7C0AF9FB79A71EF8E67FE4E182A03BB4145D248DADFAF74006835B2
- amount: "11000"
  denom: ibc/5CC0E9B98B8C719E3378F941B40A4FAC9F750A155F3788E4C449144C08EA4537
- amount: "12274000"
  denom: ibc/693989F95CF3279ADC113A6EF21B02A51EC054C95A9083F2E290126668149433
- amount: "12000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/6B3FCE336C3465D3B72F7EFB4EB92FC521BC480FE9653F627A0BD0237DF213F3
- amount: "1000000"
  denom: ibc/7F0C2CB6E79CC36D29DA7592899F98E3BEFD2CF77A94340C317032A78812393D
- amount: "2310000"
  denom: ibc/A4DB47A9D3CF9A068D454513891B526702455D3EF08FB9EB558C561F9DC2B701
- amount: "100000000000000000"
  denom: ibc/D8921A62D207159A25FFEA0DB4E7DB623A095219B60D99768CCE9D3DF66122C7
pagination:
  next_key: null
  total: "0"
```

The entire EVMOS balance of 3167501226339726493675414aevmos was transferred to the community pool after the clawback. 

## Learnings

The Evmos team will publish a detailed post-mortem document to reflect on what led to this event and how it could have been prevented. These reflections have helped us to improve our team's testing processes a lot in the past and build resilient software. We apologize for any inconvenience that this might have caused and are open to any further questions on this topic.

result.title: Incubation Proposal from ChainHub
result.plaintext:
###
# INCUBATION PROPOSAL

**Sriram Vishwanath (Professor, University of Texas Austin)**

**ChainHub & Texas Blockchain Incubator**

**sriram@chainhub.net**

#### INTRODUCTION

This proposal details an incubation partnership agreement between ChainHub (the incubation arm of Texas Blockchain) and The Evmos Community. ChainHub is an incubator, currently based in Austin TX (which is expanding to other cities in the USA in coming months) focused on University students and College Blockchain clubs. ChainHub actively incubates projects from The University of Texas, Austin and the surrounding Austin community and, post-expansion, will be incubating projects from Carnegie Mellon University as well as other Universities/Colleges within the USA.

ChainHub is managed by Sriram Vishwanath. Sriram is a Professor of Engineering at The University of Texas, Austin. He has a PhD from Stanford, an MS from Caltech and a BTech from IIT Madras. He is the faculty sponsor and founding faculty advisor of Texas Blockchain ([https://www.texasblockchain.org/](https://www.texasblockchain.org/)) and he teaches the engineering and software centric blockchain classes on University of Texas Austin campus.

Linkedin Profile: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/sriramvishwanath/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sriramvishwanath/)

#### OUR EXPERIENCE

Texas Blockchain has been working on projects within the blockchain/crypto domain for roughly 5 years, and ChainHub is its incubation arm. We currently incubate projects within two other ecosystems: Polkadot and NEAR, and we have similar agreements in place with each of the ecosystems. Some of the incubated projects include: Quai Network [https://quai.network/](https://quai.network/), Zyfty [https://zyfty.io/#/](https://zyfty.io/#/), Mirror World [https://www.mirrormy.world/](https://www.mirrormy.world/) and a few other projects still in stealth.

ChainHub proposes to work with Evmos to incubate approximately
# 1
 two projects a year, on a calendar year basis, tailored to Evmos's priorities and needs. To this end, we will work closely with Evmos to converge on two or more projects and bring together a highly capable team to deliver on each project. These teams will be mentored, managed and funded by ChainHub through a grant provided by Evmos (see budget request below).

#### SUMMARY OF TERMS

1. ChainHub will:
  1. Incubate approximately two projects per year, starting with September 2022. These projects will be selected in close coordination with the Evmos team.
  2. Support these projects from their inception to minimum viable product (MVP) completion. We will staff each project with a talented and passionate team of students/alumni from the Universities/Colleges with which we are co-located.
2. Evmos will:

1. The Evmos Foundation will work closely with ChainHub to identify projects and mentor each project team.
2. The Evmos Community ChainHub (see budget request below) will provide resources necessary towards execution.
3. The Evmos Foundation will partner with each project team: help with pitch-deck/fundraising, product roadmap and long term strategic growth of each entity resulting from this incubation process.

With the exception of 2022, ChainHub will submit a new proposal in Q1 of each calendar year for the Evmos Community's consideration for renewal of this engagement for that calendar year.

#### BUDGET REQUEST

As tokens are volatile and ChainHub/Texas Blockchain will bear all the costs of development of the project, we request $1M in tokens per calendar year for the duration of this incubation agreement. This will cover the costs of project incubation (including developers, designers, audits, incubation space and operational support for each project).

We request the tokens be provided as follows:

1. The first 50% at kickoff with Evmos (285714 Evmos equivalent to $0.5M)
2. The next 25% when the first project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)
3. The final 25% when the second project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)

A breakdown of costs across the two projects are (these are rough order of magnitude):

1. Engineering Team/Developers/Product Lead - 625K
2. Full time Designer (for both projects) - 75K
3. Incubation space - 100K (covers space rent, utilities, laptops, monitors, all infrastructure including 6 servers)
4. Audits - 125K (for the entire platform(s) including full stack software, not just the smart contracts)
5. Operational Staff (payroll/HR/health insurance/misc software) - 75K

Each engineering team/devs/product lead will comprise of: approximately 2 Web3 + backend engineers, 1 part-time or full time front-end engineers, and 1 product lead.

The tokens will be staked and existing incubator resources will be used until those resources are exhausted. When exhausted, we will primarily aim to use OTC services to convert tokens to USD. When OTC services are unavailable or limited, we will use other means of conversion to USD. If OTC services are unavailable, we will limit ourselves to at most 50K a month in conversion to USD.

A multisig will be set up to manage this schedule by members of the community. When the Evmos Foundation marks a particular project's MVP as complete, the associated tranche of tokens will be released to ChainHub.

#### PROPOSED PROJECTS

 **EvLend**

Project Specs: [https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/](https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/)

EvLend aims to be the most efficient variable rate borrow-lend market on Evmos.

EvLend uses reactive interest rate technology to target specific utilization rates (% of funds in the money market being borrowed) for stablecoin assets while still providing support for borrow & lend services to other assets.

Reactive interest rates are a more recent innovation popularized by Euler finance. EvLend takes the power of this concept and maximizes it for stablecoin markets.

EvLend can demonstrate a standard model by which maximum efficiency of interest rates may be reached. Building such a system can lead to economies of scale and majority share of lending volume for a given core stablecoin.

More information on reactive rates, our stablecoin focus, and project development timeline can be found in the GitBook specs link above.

**Evmos Bridge**

Project Specs: [https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/](https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/)

We propose a bridge tailored to maximize the ease of onboarding into the Evmos ecosystem. Our solution focuses on supporting the most bridge paths into and out of Evmos as well as focusing on user education to increase usage within the Evmos and broader Cosmos ecosystem.

The proposed bridge will consist of a liquidity network architecture utilizing native assets and thus no minting and burning. Additionally, we will build the cross-chain protocol leveraging a battle tested security and consensus model that is as secure as the economic security of the blockchains it is built upon.

With the minimal bridge paths available today, Evmos will continue to struggle with onboarding users and value into the ecosystem.

Providing routes for users to bridge from the most popular DeFi hubs such as Optimism, Polygon, Arbitrum, Avalanche, among others, streamlines the process for users to onboard value into Evmos by orders of magnitude.

For more information regarding the specifications of the bridge please refer to the documentation or reach back out to us for any further questions.

[1](#sdfootnote1anc) We say "approximate" as we may not converge on two projects, or may converge on more than two per year. Our goal will remain to incubate at least two per year.

Some of the incubated projects include: Quai Network [https://quai.network/](https://quai.network/), Zyfty [https://zyfty.io/#/](https://zyfty.io/#/), Mirror World [https://www.mirrormy.world/](https://www.mirrormy.world/) and a few other projects still in stealth.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"ChainHub proposes to work with Evmos to incubate approximately\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"# 1\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\" two projects a year, on a calendar year basis, tailored to Evmos's priorities and needs. To this end, we will work closely with Evmos to converge on two or more projects and bring together a highly capable team to deliver on each project. These teams will be mentored, managed and funded by ChainHub through a grant provided by Evmos (see budget request below).\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"#### SUMMARY OF TERMS\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. ChainHub will:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"  1. Incubate approximately two projects per year, starting with September 2022. These projects will be selected in close coordination with the Evmos team.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"  2. Support these projects from their inception to minimum viable product (MVP) completion. We will staff each project with a talented and passionate team of students/alumni from the Universities/Colleges with which we are co-located.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. Evmos will:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. The Evmos Foundation will work closely with ChainHub to identify projects and mentor each project team.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. The Evmos Community ChainHub (see budget request below) will provide resources necessary towards execution.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"3. The Evmos Foundation will partner with each project team: help with pitch-deck/fundraising, product roadmap and long term strategic growth of each entity resulting from this incubation process.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"With the exception of 2022, ChainHub will submit a new proposal in Q1 of each calendar year for the Evmos Community's consideration for renewal of this engagement for that calendar year.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"#### BUDGET REQUEST\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"As tokens are volatile and ChainHub/Texas Blockchain will bear all the costs of development of the project, we request $1M in tokens per calendar year for the duration of this incubation agreement. This will cover the costs of project incubation (including developers, designers, audits, incubation space and operational support for each project).\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"We request the tokens be provided as follows:\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. The first 50% at kickoff with Evmos (285714 Evmos equivalent to $0.5M)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. The next 25% when the first project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"3. The final 25% when the second project is determined to be completed by Evmos Foundation (142857 Evmos equivalent to $0.25M)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"A breakdown of costs across the two projects are (these are rough order of magnitude):\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. Engineering Team/Developers/Product Lead - 625K\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"2. Full time Designer (for both projects) - 75K\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"3. Incubation space - 100K (covers space rent, utilities, laptops, monitors, all infrastructure including 6 servers)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"4. Audits - 125K (for the entire platform(s) including full stack software, not just the smart contracts)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"5. Operational Staff (payroll/HR/health insurance/misc software) - 75K\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Each engineering team/devs/product lead will comprise of: approximately 2 Web3 + backend engineers, 1 part-time or full time front-end engineers, and 1 product lead.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"The tokens will be staked and existing incubator resources will be used until those resources are exhausted. When exhausted, we will primarily aim to use OTC services to convert tokens to USD. When OTC services are unavailable or limited, we will use other means of conversion to USD. If OTC services are unavailable, we will limit ourselves to at most 50K a month in conversion to USD.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"A multisig will be set up to manage this schedule by members of the community. When the Evmos Foundation marks a particular project's MVP as complete, the associated tranche of tokens will be released to ChainHub.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"#### PROPOSED PROJECTS\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. **EvLend**\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Project Specs: [https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/](https://sierra-fi.gitbook.io/evlend/)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"EvLend aims to be the most efficient variable rate borrow-lend market on Evmos.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"EvLend uses reactive interest rate technology to target specific utilization rates (% of funds in the money market being borrowed) for stablecoin assets while still providing support for borrow & lend services to other assets.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Reactive interest rates are a more recent innovation popularized by Euler finance. EvLend takes the power of this concept and maximizes it for stablecoin markets.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"EvLend can demonstrate a standard model by which maximum efficiency of interest rates may be reached. Building such a system can lead to economies of scale and majority share of lending volume for a given core stablecoin.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"More information on reactive rates, our stablecoin focus, and project development timeline can be found in the GitBook specs link above.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"1. **Evmos Bridge**\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Project Specs: [https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/](https://crest-protocol.gitbook.io/evmos-bridge-specs/)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"We propose a bridge tailored to maximize the ease of onboarding into the Evmos ecosystem. Our solution focuses on supporting the most bridge paths into and out of Evmos as well as focusing on user education to increase usage within the Evmos and broader Cosmos ecosystem.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"The proposed bridge will consist of a liquidity network architecture utilizing native assets and thus no minting and burning. Additionally, we will build the cross-chain protocol leveraging a battle tested security and consensus model that is as secure as the economic security of the blockchains it is built upon.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"With the minimal bridge paths available today, Evmos will continue to struggle with onboarding users and value into the ecosystem.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Providing routes for users to bridge from the most popular DeFi hubs such as Optimism, Polygon, Arbitrum, Avalanche, among others, streamlines the process for users to onboard value into Evmos by orders of magnitude.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"For more information regarding the specifications of the bridge please refer to the documentation or reach back out to us for any further questions.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"[1](#sdfootnote1anc) We say \\\"approximate\\\" as we may not converge on two projects, or may converge on more than two per year. Our goal will remain to incubate at least two per year.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"code-block\":\"plain\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"}]}"}

result.title: Temperature Check - Extending Osmosis External Incentives
result.plaintext:
Hi all,

This is a follow up to Proposal 39 to introduce Evmos external incentives in Osmosis, Pool 722 (EVMOS/OSMO) . The original Commonwealth discussion can be found HERE .

Background

We have had great success with incentivizing the EVMOS/OSMO pool on Osmosis through Prop 39 and providing 600,000 EVMOS tokens for external incentives over 90 days. Since then, EVMOS has become one of the most popular pools on Osmosis through TVL, volume, and daily APRs. At the time of writing, the pool has grown from just $2M, now to the 6th largest pool on osmosis with a TVL of $7.3M (Peaking at $10M) and 3rd highest 7-day volume of $6.5M. The number of tokens locked in the LP have grown from 700k EVMOS before the incentives started to now just over 2M! The incentives that helped drive this success will be expiring on October 18th , so the community needs to decide the next steps forward!

(image)

Questions

#1) Does the community wish to extend the Osmosis External Incentives?

#2) If so, how many tokens? For how many days?

Proposal

UPDATE OCT 4th 2022

Based on poll results and community feedback in Discord and Commonwealth, seems like the preferred path forward is another 600k EVMOS over 90 days . Osmosis is the gateway for new users into the Cosmos ecosystem so it is important to maintain deep liquidity. Once this period is over, we can reevaluate the incentives as we will have a clearer picture with how native liquidity has grown.

600k EVMOS over a 90 day period (6,666.67 EVMOS per day), 100 EVMOS for funding Osmosis gauge creation and filling. (Updated Oct. 8th)

TOTAL : 600,100 EVMOS

14 day bond only

Pool 722 (EVMOS/OSMO)

MULTISIG (3/4)

0xbAFE2Ae09c621462032BbC7FC997aA89c9780639

bennylava - Evmos Community Manager/Evmos Governance Workstream

@Tricky | Cosmos Spaces  - Evmos Governance Workstream

LPX - Evmos Governance Workstream

JohnnyWyles - Osmosis Labs

Timeline

A proposal would need to be on-chain no later than October 10th and subsequently passed to allow for enough time to refill the gauge and have no disruption in external incentive rewards.

-benny

result.title: Blockchain%20Classification%20System%20%5BBCS%5D%20for%20Research%20Topics
result.plaintext:
## Blockchain Classification System [BCS]

Our chain owes its very existence to previous research and implementation:

- Bitcoin
- Ethereum
- Cosmos SDK
- Ethermint

Even presently: most research is done by a handful of projects (See [ETH Research](https://ethresear.ch/)), and most other communities and derived chains benefit as freeloaders.

This situation is not morally acceptable. We should and we want to give back resources and a direction for research.

We suggest the creation of a classification system for the domain of knowledge of blockchain that is intuitive, simple to navigate, and able to attract resources and support for further research.

### Method

Given the root concept of "Blockchain Research", construct a SKOS graph (as free of internal loops as possible) that will have the research papers as nodes.

The system should be in version 1:

1. decentralized
2. searchable
3. data dump downloadable
4. linking at least to the most important papers

We should seek to also provide for the next versions:

- incentivized peer review
- incentivized maintenance

### Resources

We may find the following resources useful:

- [Computing Classification System](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SubjectRaw/SubjectRaw/gh-pages/subject/data/eng/computing.md) in MD format
- [Computing Classification System](https://dl.acm.org/pb-assets/dl_ccs/acm_ccs2012-1626988337597.xml) in XML SKOS format
- [An initial map of the blockchain knowledge](https://github.com/the-laurel/governance/blob/main/docs/StrategicLandscape.md)

### Start

Since the normal placement of blockchain tech is usually:

- everything knowable
...
  - Mathematics
    - Applied Mathematics
      - Computer Science
      ...
        - Decentralized Systems
          - Decentralized Ledger
            - Blockchain Technologies

But Blockchain tech has obvious relationships with governance, ethics, Economics, etc. So, when we put it at the root level, the immediate next level will have to be the linked Sciences (including Computer Science)

- Blockchain Technologies
  - Mathematics
  - Computer Science (deepest and most populated tree expected under this node)
  - Philosophy, Ethics
  - Economics
  - Sociology

Each of these domains of knowledge has its own classification graph. If that graph has a node related to Blockchain, that node has to be presented in the BCS.

### Implementation

As in any SKOS system, we can opt for a flexible RDF triples database for information persistence that is further linked with the official classifications graphs (such as those referred to in the previous section) in such a way that the web2 and/or web3 navigation can access the actual research papers that are hosted on sites like https://arxiv.org/
That means a full-text search for the (labels of the) nodes in the database.

### Funding Items

Those are in the ascending order of expected value:
- hosting a database with good indexing for full-text search: maybe a distributed PostgreSQL-like
- hosting 2 websites (one for the research graph and one for discussions)
- creating the site for discussions with the academic interest of Evmos, Ethermint, and Cosmos SDK as core (same model as https://ethereum-magicians.org/. maybe using the same [tech](https://github.com/discourse/discourse))
- creating a web service that is able to add, modify, search, dump data, interface with https://arxiv.org/, maybe even with Semantic Web
- expertise in data creation:
  - additions/modifications to the RDF graph (knowledge domain linking with already-accepted terminologies and classifications)
  - motivation for peer review entries of new research
  - linking each paper also to public discussions
  - proposing papers for blockchain developers and communities for implementation or financial support

### Management

To start this project, Christian Tzurcanu (the author of this proposal), will work as a volunteer tasked from The Laurel Project in the interest and for the honor and fame of the Evmos Community. He will maintain the transparency of accounting on [this GitHub page](BCS_Accounting.md).
Therefore, the management will be free of payment and with provable results.

### Discussion

This discussion will not be included on-chain, but will be referenced in the on-chain text. It has these main directions: 

- improvements to the proposal text to arrive at its final (on-chain) form
- price discovery of the first useable version
- the initial list of domain experts or teams willing to participate in this first version
- additional ideas, improvements of the end product

result.title: Nasty%20nasty%20decay
result.plaintext:
Just found out I would have had 350 evmos to claim in an older wallet that I have not been using for a long time. Imported my Metamask address on the rektdrop page, just to find out: it is all gone. This sucks. This has been such a troubled year, even tax authorities around the world extend their deadlines, and here we have a 2 month decay? Seriously? That's bullshit. It has literally become a REKTdrop, muchas gracias!!!!!!

This is not some shitcoin airdrop across every wallet on the blockchain. Every user who was entitled to free EVMOS had some skin in the game and there were active wallet addresses behind each, so why was this not automatically airdropped to the wallets in question? Instead of creating a destructive decay mechanism?

At least the period should have been extended by years, not months. Persistence is what I like most about crypto. If I don´t have contact with my bank for awhile, the account will become dormant and at some point, the account and the money will be gone. Not so with crypto. Even after years of dormancy, the funds are still on the private key, as long as the blockchain exists.

This decay is a nasty thing to do, and so I am asking the question: how realistic is a proposal to remedy the situation? For instance: everyone who would have had an EVMOS airdrop claim, will receive their decayed funds retroactively, without further activity needed from the user side? This could be achieved by an automatic process running at a given date, e.g. end of 2022, or by a permanent link on the dashboard. To keep things simple, entering an address (cosmos or evmos) and hitting "claim" should be enough. So no need to maintain a complicated rektdrop dashboard over the long term.

Currently, the unclaimed funds will be returned to the community wallet, but for what purpose? Pissing off users who missed the deadline, are much less likely to use the project in the future. This will cause more loss of value to the token, than the returned funds will be worth.
version_history: {"timestamp":"2022-09-29T21:39:34.455Z","author":"{\"_judgements\":{},\"_isOnchain\":false,\"_isCouncillor\":false,\"_isValidator\":false,\"_isEmpty\":true,\"_isNameInvalid\":false,\"chain\":\"evmos\",\"address\":\"evmos1x8lrmjhtncl2r7xjt978wv5vpluvyg06yfm2u2\",\"_initialized\":true}","body":"{\"ops\":[{\"insert\":\"Just found out I would have had 350 evmos to claim in an older wallet that I have not been using for a long time. Imported my Metamask address on the rektdrop page, just to find out: it is all gone. This sucks. This has been such a troubled year, even tax authorities around the world extend their deadlines, and here we have a 2 month decay? Seriously? That's bullshit. It has literally become a REKTdrop, muchas gracias!!!!!!\\n\\nThis is not some shitcoin airdrop across every wallet on the blockchain. Every user who was entitled to free EVMOS had some skin in the game and there were active wallet addresses behind each, so why was this not automatically airdropped to the wallets in question? Instead of creating a destructive decay mechanism?\\n\\nAt least the period should have been extended by years, not months. Persistence is what I like most about crypto. If I don´t have contact with my bank for awhile, the account will become dormant and at some point, the account and the money will be gone. Not so with crypto. Even after years of dormancy, the funds are still on the private key, as long as the blockchain exists.\\n\\nThis decay is a nasty thing to do, and so I am asking the question: how realistic is a proposal to remedy the situation? For instance: everyone who would have had an EVMOS airdrop claim, will receive their decayed funds retroactively, without further activity needed from the user side? This could be achieved by an automatic process running at a given date, e.g. end of 2022, or by a permanent link on the dashboard. To keep things simple, entering an address (cosmos or evmos) and hitting \\\"claim\\\" should be enough. So no need to maintain a complicated rektdrop dashboard over the long term.\\n\\nCurrently, the unclaimed funds will be returned to the community wallet, but for what purpose?
